bt.Model

Class PeerSpooler

  • java.lang.Object
    • bt.Model.PeerSpooler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class PeerSpooler
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    It will be in charge of spooling, choking and unchoking peers every N amount of time.
    Author:
    Isaac Yochelson, Robert Schomburg and Fernando Geraci.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void execute()
      If there are 4 or more connections available, it will rank the peers by their download rate, leave the first 3 unchoked, choke the 4th and then pick a random one for unchoking.
      private Peer getRandomPeer(Peer[] rest)
      Randomly selects a peer from a provided list.
      private Peer[] getRankedList(java.util.List<Peer> peers)
      Returns a ranked array by download rate of peers.
      void run()

      • execute

        private void execute()
        If there are 4 or more connections available, it will rank the peers by their download rate, leave the first 3 unchoked, choke the 4th and then pick a random one for unchoking.
